question_title: Will the Bank of Japan raise its policy interest rate again before May 1, 2026?
summary: The BOJ held rates at 0.75% at its January 22-23 meeting. Two more meetings fall before May 1: March (~mid-March) and April 27-28. A Reuters poll (Jan 15) shows 97% of economists expect no change through March, and the consensus timing for the next hike is July 2026. However, a CNBC sources article (Jan 16) reveals some BOJ policymakers see April as "a distinct possibility," driven by yen weakness and broadening inflation. The yen is currently at ~152, well below the 160 level Citigroup cites as a trigger for an early hike. Spring wage negotiation results and the April 1 BOJ business survey will be key data available before the April meeting. Political uncertainty from the Feb 8 snap election adds near-term caution. The combined probability of a hike at either the March (~3%) or April (~30%) meeting is roughly 32%.

factors.description: Reuters poll: 97% of 67 economists expect no BOJ rate change at January AND March meetings. Consensus timing for next hike is July 2026.
CNBC sources (Jan 16): 4 sources familiar with BOJ thinking say April is 'a distinct possibility' due to yen weakness and inflationary pressure.
Yen at ~152, well below the 160 threshold Citigroup and State Street cite as trigger for an early (April) hike.
BOJ tightening trajectory: hiked 4 times since March 2024, governor Ueda signals willingness to continue. Real rates remain significantly negative.
Spring wage negotiation results and April 1 BOJ business survey will provide key data before April 27-28 meeting, potentially justifying action.
Political uncertainty from Feb 8 snap election adds caution; BOJ typically avoids moves around elections.
BOJ pattern of patience: waited 11 months between Jan 2025 and Dec 2025 hikes. An April hike would be only 4 months after December.
ING base case: October 2026 for next hike. Represents the 'dovish consensus' view.
Two meetings remain in window (March + April 27-28), giving two opportunities. April meeting falls just before May 1 deadline.
